48278-d-06-14-83-RFP.Narrative: WHILE CAR DUPX 29714, A NINETY-FOOT EMPTY TANK CAR, WAS BEING CLASSIFIED OVER THE NORTHBOUND HUMP TONUMBER 30 TRACK IN THE NORTHBOUND CLASSIFICATION YARD, A DERAILMENT OCCURRED WHEN THE 25-50-LEAD SWITCH WAS THROWN BETWEEN THE TRUCKS OF THE CAR, RESULTING IN THE SOUTH TRUCKS HEADING INTO THE 41-50LEAD AND DERAILING THE R AND L 5-6-7-8 WHEELS. THE HUMP CONDUCTOR WAS CHARGED WITH THE RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE ACCIDENT IN THAT HE ENTERED THE CODE IN THE ROUTE SELECTOR FOR A FOLLOWING CAR BEFORE THEROUTE SELECTOR FOR THE NINETY-FOOT TANK CAR HAD DISAPPEARED, RESULTING IN THE DERAILMENT. THIS WAS IN VIOLATION OF RULE 12 OF THE POTOMAC YARD SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS, WHICH STATES: 12. WHEN CLASSIFYINGEXCEPTIONALLY LONG TANK CARS OVER THE NORTHBOUND HUMP, NO SELECTION SHOULD BE MADE BY THE HUMP CONDUCTOR FOR A FOLLOWING ROUTE UNTIL EACH EXCEPTIONALLY LONG TANK CAR IS NORTH OF THE MASTER RETARDERS AND THE ROUTE SELECTION FOR THAT TANK CAR HAS DISAPPEARED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

ON JUNE 3,1983. CAR ARIX 1189 WAS ONE OF A TWO-CAR CUT RELEASED FROM THE RETARDER AT AN EXCESSIVE RATE OF SPEED. CAR ARIX 1189 WAS THE NORTH CAR IN THE TWO-CAR CUT, CLASSIFIED OVER THE NORTHBOUND HUMP INTO NO. 37 TRACK, THAT INPACTED HEAVILY WITH SCL 816701, A LOADED BOX CAR THE SOUTHERNMOST CAR IN A CUT OF FORTY-SIX (46) CARS SITTING ON NO. 37 TRACK.
